greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Difference between the number of occurrences of prime gaps not divisible by 3, versus number of prime gaps that are multiples of 3, up to n-th prime gap: a(n) = A269849(n) - A269850(n).
comment: This is related to "Lemke Oliver-Soundararajan bias", term first used by Terence Tao March 14, 2016 in his blog.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..50000
Robert J. Lemke Oliver and Kannan Soundararajan, Unexpected biases in the distribution of consecutive primes, arXiv:1603.03720 [math.NT], 2016.
Terence Tao, Biases between consecutive primes, blog entry March 14, 2016
program: (PARI) a(n) = sum(k=1, n, ((prime(k+1) - prime(k)) % 3) != 0) - sum(k=1, n, ((prime(k+1) - prime(k)) % 3) == 0); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 18 2016
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 17 2016
